main event: A torpedo-shaped object was observed flying over Durban, South Africa on February 24, 1951.
interesting points: The object was described as changing colors from silver to gold as it moved in the sky., It was hovering at about 4:00 p.m. and observed for approximately two minutes., Several witnesses, including Captain Francis Williamson, reported seeing the object and stated it made no noise., Passengers at Merewbank station also reported seeing a similar torpedo-shaped object that appeared blue., The sighting involved civilian observations and was documented in local newspapers.
witness description: Civilian, including Captain Francis Williamson and passengers at a train station
